body_html:
I know the guy who wrote it from the C++ community and he's a pretty good developer. Catch2 is also officially supported by Jetbrains for their IDEs so it's pretty solid I think!

Also, a nice thing about Catch is that it does crazy magic to make assertions with binary operators work, i.e. you can assert(x == y) where in GTest you'd have to write ASSERT_EQ(x, y)
body_text:
I know the guy who wrote it from the C++ community and he's a pretty good developer. Catch2 is also officially supported by Jetbrains for their IDEs so it's pretty solid I think!
Also, a nice thing about Catch is that it does crazy magic to make assertions with binary operators work, i.e. you can assert(x == y) where in GTest you'd have to write ASSERT_EQ(x, y)
body:
I know the guy who wrote it from the C++ community and he's a pretty good developer. Catch2 is also officially supported by Jetbrains for their IDEs so it's pretty solid I think!

Also, a nice thing about Catch is that it does crazy magic to make assertions with binary operators work, i.e. you can `assert(x == y)` where in GTest you'd have to write `ASSERT_EQ(x, y)`
